item.title: Raja Rajeswari Medical College Conducts its Third Disaster Management Training

Continue reading "Raja Rajeswari Medical College Conducts its Third Disaster Management Training"
item.content:encoded:
Public health emergencies are caused as a result of threats such as storms, epidemics, accidents, several other unforeseen calamities and also due to biological, chemical, or radiological disasters. Although each one is different and require unique responses, preparing and learning about public health emergencies can help equip and protect your family. Threats strike when they are expected the least and because of this, preparation is the way forward in this kind of disaster. Learning more about these disasters, diseases, treatments and how these may affect your family is a big step.

Rajarajeswari Medical College & Hospital is conducting their third training on “Public Health Emergencies & Disasters -Preparedness & Response‚Äù from 10th September 2012 To 14th September 2012.The training will be conducted in their MEDICAL EDUCATION UNIT, 1ST FLOOR.
